instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332-A with no audio
threads.message:
Hello,

bought a Macbook Pro 15 Retina mid 2012 with damaged audio jack, internal speakers work fine. When I plug in a known good audio board 821-1548-A (headphone jack), nothing works, no internal speakers, no headphones, and I get the red light inside port. 

Any suggestions?

threads.title: 820-3332-A with no audio
threads.message: Pretty sure your known good jack is the problem. Removing R6896 should also fix the problem.

threads.title: 820-3332-A with no audio
threads.message: I took the known good jack from another Retina 15 early 2013 and it is definitely OK. Will removing R6896 kill the digital out functionality? If that's the case, I can live with that. Thank you for the useful answer.

threads.title: 820-3332-A with no audio
threads.message: Yes it will disable SPDIF, who really cares?
